Description: One end of a matress cover, weft-faced compound, plain weave textile in linen and purple wool; Plain bands of weft loops (c.3cm long, paired linen threads occuring after 7-9 picks) alternating with double rows of roundels with figures from a hunting scene, the figures repeating across the cloth but changing down its length; From right to left - boy spearing boar, dog chasing goat, boy shooting arrow at lion, leopardess chasing bear?; Warp: wool, S spun, 6-7 tpc; Weft: wool S spun, linen S spun, c.68-76 tpc in decoration (ie: 34-38 passes), c.50-60 tpc outside; Edges: 2 main selvedges, 1 starting border (linen, single cord)
Curator's comments: Originally in Egyptian department. 1888,5-12,120; EA 21703 Re: display in G41, case 19, see Buckton 1994, no. 50; See BEP OA 1442 (MCB 1761); Probably found almost complete and cut by dealer; Other fragments are EA, Ashmolean (1888.743, from Akhmim, frag. with lion) and V&A (1286-1888, Kendrick Vol. II, no.536, from Akhmim); Probably a mattress cover; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (11.7.1989) CHECK DIMENSIONS [ERO 14.01.2020]
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
